com.camerontec.catalys.util.ssl

Class KeyCopy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.ssl.KeyCopy

  • public final class KeyCopy
extends Object
    Copy a PrivateKey and Certificate from a PKCS#12 file to a JKS keystore.
    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 04/Dec/2001, revised 07/Feb/2003.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static void main(String[] args)
      Usage: KeyCopy -file file [-password password] [-alias alias] [-keystore keystore] [-storepass storepass] [-keypass keypass] [-append]

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Usage: KeyCopy -file file [-password password] [-alias alias] [-keystore keystore] [-storepass storepass] [-keypass keypass] [-append]

        This utility copies a private key and certificate from a PKCS#12 file, such as is created by Internet Explorer's export certificate function, to a JKS keystore that can be used with the Catalys SSL add-on.

        The keystore being copied to will be created or overwritten under normal usage. However, if the "-append" option is specified and the keystore file already exists, the new key will be added to it.

        • -file file The PKCS#12 file created in Internet Explorer, with a ".pfx " or " .p12" extension.
        • -password password The password that was specified when the PKCS#12 file was created. If not specified, "password" is assumed.
        • -alias alias The alias to assign to the key copied to the JKS keystore. If not specified, the base name of the PKCS#12 file is used.
        • -keystore keystore The JKS keystore that the key is to be copied to. If not supplied, a file of the same name as the alias will be used, with a ".keystore" extension. It will be placed in the same directory as the PKCS#12 file.
        • -storepass storepass The keystore password that will encrypt the keystore. Defaults to the keypass if one is specified, otherwise it defaults to the same as password.
        • -keypass keypass The key password that protects the key entry. Defaults to the storepass if one is specified, otherwise it defaults to the same as password.
        • -append If present, and the keystore already exists, the new key will be added to the keystore instead of overwriting it. In this case, the storepass must be correct for the existing keystore file.
        Parameters:
        args - command line args
